poem:
**At the Gates of Aid**

red ribbons  
wind through the dust—  
bodies upon bodies  

a child reaches  
for bread,  
a hand wraps  
around emptiness  

the sun looks away,  
clouds gather  
in silence—  

underneath the sky  
splintered with cries,  
hope hangs  
like tattered cloth  
in the dry wind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gaza aid workers overwhelmed by ‘mass casualty incidents’ at food distribution sites Medical officials, humanitarian workers and doctors in Gaza say they have been overwhelmed by almost daily “mass casualty incidents” as they struggle to deal with those wounded by Israeli fire on Palestinians seeking aid. Doctors said many of the casualties they are treating describe being shot as they try to reach distribution sites run by the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), a secretive US-". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
